ServiceNow Patches Critical AI Platform Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated User Impersonation

AI 5 min read

ServiceNow has released patches for a critical security vulnerability in its AI platform that could allow unauthenticated users to impersonate legitimate accounts. The flaw, which was discovered and reported by security researchers, posed a significant risk as it could enable attackers to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information and systems. ServiceNow has urged users to apply the updates promptly to mitigate potential security breaches. This move underscores the importance of regularly updating software to protect against emerging threats and safeguard user data and system integrity.

It delves into the complexities of managing multiple control points (MCPs), ensuring secure tool access, and addressing the issue of shadow API key sprawl, which can lead to unauthorized access and security vulnerabilities. New Malware Campaign Delivers Remcos RAT Through Multi-Stage Windows Attack

AI 5 min read

A recent cybersecurity report highlights a sophisticated malware campaign utilizing a multi-stage attack strategy to deliver the Remcos Remote Access Trojan (RAT) on Windows systems. The campaign begins with phishing emails that contain malicious attachments or links, which, when engaged, execute a series of obfuscated scripts to bypass security measures. These scripts eventually deliver the Remcos RAT, allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access to users' systems.
